definition[0]: needing or waiting to be paid
example[0]: the companyâ€™s accounts receivable  (=sales that have been made but not yet paid for)
example[1]: Pretax profit including net interest receivable was up 42%.
definition[2]: money owed to a business by its clients and shown in its accounts as an asset
example[2]: The company had more than $10 million in cash and $10 million in accounts receivable.
definition[3]: a note relating to money that a company is owed
example[3]: It said the estimated adjustments are for write-downs on the carrying value of its assets - primarily notes receivable.
